lead_paragraph: SOMERBY--Richard Alfred, 85, of Naples, FL, Hartsdale, NY and formerly a resident of New Canaan, CT, died peacefully Wednesday, January 13, 2016 having had his family by his side for his final days. Born October 10, 1930 in Boston, MA, he was the son of a Boston theatre owner, Rufus and his wife Sylvia Somerby. He graduated from Williams College in 1952. Participating on many athletic teams during his school years, one of his favorite memories was the selection of his Tabor Academy crew team for the Henley Regatta in England. Always a proud Veteran, he served as an officer in the United States Air Force during the Korean conflict. After earning his MBA from Harvard Business School in 1956, he spent his entire career working for IBM as an executive in marketing and sales. He and his wife Mary Louise Vincent settled in New Canaan in the early 1960s to raise their five children. His retirement years were spent as an active community participant, joining the North Naples Fire Control and Rescue Squad as a certified member of their emergency response team. He was a member of the Harvard Club of Naples, The Williams Club of Naples, and the English-Speaking Union. He is survived by his five children: Richard, Craig, Anne, Elizabeth and Daniel as well as 12 grandchildren and three great-grandchildren. The family will hold a private ceremony on Cape Cod, MA. 1/3
